definition: to offer for sale/to sell/to sell out or betray

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

sentences.english: Jack got the cold shoulder from his classmates after he double-crossed his best friend.
sentences.chinese: 自从杰克出卖了他最好的朋友后，同班同学都冷落他。

sentences.english: I am just calling to follow up on the status of the Sales Manager position.
sentences.chinese: 我打电话只是想问一下出卖经理这个职位的延聘状况。

sentences.english: And, to quote an old advertising adage , sex sells.
sentences.chinese: 套用一句广告俗语，那就是“出卖色相”。

sentences.english: Under the threat that is 9, the flying cloud finally betrayed mu yao.
sentences.chinese: 在尚九城的恐吓之下，那云飞终于出卖了慕瑶。

sentences.english: Harry is so addicted to alcohol that he'd sell his soul for a bottle of whisky.
sentences.chinese: 沉溺于喝酒，结果他会为一瓶威士忌而出卖灵魂的。

sentences.english: Michael confronts Roland about setting them up, but he denies it.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔逼问是否罗兰德出卖了他们，他抵死不认。

sentences.english: He bartered away his pride for material gain.
sentences.chinese: 他为贪图物质财富而出卖了他的自尊心。

sentences.english: Or “sell your soul and the money follows.
sentences.chinese: 或者说，“出卖你的灵魂而财源滚滚”。

sentences.english: I would as lief kill myself as betray my master.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿自杀也不会出卖我的主人。

sentences.english: We haven't ratted on our friends.
He maddened at the thought of how he had been betrayed.
sentences.chinese: 他一想起自己被出卖的情形就怒不可遏。

sentences.english: He was split on by his friend.
sentences.chinese: 他是被他的朋友出卖的。

sentences.english: Can only lie to others in exchange for betraying the truth that has been late?
sentences.chinese: 只有撒谎出卖别人才能换回那已经迟到的真相？

sentences.english: Any dares who love to betray the soul, all have the power to change the world.
sentences.chinese: 任何胆敢为爱出卖灵魂的人，都拥有改变世界的力量。

sentences.english: It sold both precious stones and the better kinds of jewellry .
sentences.chinese: 它出卖珍贵的钻石和上等珠宝。

definition: to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to rely on help from sb
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
